content.text: Currently, when a new global template is created, it is disabled/OFF by default for all issue types and all projects.
We want to reverse it as we think it will be more natural and aligned with CFJ behavior.

agents to know when checklist is visible to customers, so they don’t put any sensitive/internal information on the checklist.

full checklist

customers. We don’t care/handle showing the progress only.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

content.text: Summary
Many customers are sending support requests asking for functionalities they had on Checklist for Jira Server in Issue Checklist Pro.

Currently, there are features in Issue Checklist Pro that give a similar, if not exactly the same functionality as they had in Checklist For Jira Server e.g.: Checklists that appear in all issues or in issues of a specific type, called Checklist Definitions in CFJS, can be done through Templates in IC Pro.
These features need to be listed.
It is also important to clarify the difference between certain terms and names, e.g.: a checklist in CFJS is a “custom field”, but in IC Pro it is pure text.
These terms need to be clarified.

fields.summary: Create CFJS-to-IC funtionalities comparison table in user documentation

content.text: Let's make it simple and add a template with the same name as label added when an issue is created or updated:
on /issue-updated, if the checklist items already exist then append new template
on /issue-created, if there is YAML content or default template???
should we enable that functionality with a switch/toggle in the configuration? (probably not to make it simple as having a template with the same name as a label will be extremely rare)

content.text: When saving a template in the “edit template” dialog, the “item input” becomes invisible during the Save operation, making the dialog height smaller and causing an unpleasant visual effect.

align “changed” label (move it close to the template name so its location depends on the template name length)
align template name so it is visually in the same horizontal position as the content below
slightly increase space between buttons

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

content.text: We want to disable self-mentioning notifications.
When the user is mentioned, and the notifications are enabled in
Global Settings
, the user gets an email. It is a handy feature, but we want to filter the users, so I don’t get notifications when I mention myself.
We don’t want any additional configuration for it. Let’s just change the code and make it a default behaviour that self notification email is not sent.

issuetype.name: Improvement

content.text: We want to warn the user that deleting the template will also delete corresponding data from the issue.
We currently display only this:
And we want something like this:
Title: Are you sure you want to delete this global template?
Text: Deleting the global template will also remove the toggle status for this template in all related Jira issues.
Additional improvements / fixes
Refactor files to Typescript
Add types
Enable Calendar and Emoji picker for Global Templates but keep Mention picker disabled

fields.summary: Improve Global Template delete confirmation dialog

content.text: When accessing templates list from the project page, there is an unpleasant flash of "no templates found" message.
I think it stays there until list of templates is retrieved.
Let's show some progress spinner when loading instead of the incorrect message. Or, if we can get the initial list of templates from server when page loads, that would work too.

fields.summary: Remove the flash of "no templates found" on the templates list in project page
